required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Changes in Haemostasis After Therapeutic Plasmapheresis With Citrate Anticoagulation
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Interventional Study to Investigate Changes in Haemostasis After Therapeutic Plasmapheresis With Citrate Anticoagulation With or Without Coagulation Factors Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: Plasma exchange procedures remove procoagulant and anticoagulant factors. Every procedure increases the risk of bleeding and repeated procedures increase the risk of bleeding mostly because lower fibrinogen levels. The aim of study is to define coagulation status of patient after plasmapheresis with different laboratory tests and to investigate the possibility of fibrinogen concentrate replacement for the correction of induced coagulation disorder.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of plasmapheresis replacement fluid type on fibrinogen level
primary_outcome.time_frame: Right after every plasmapheresis session, during the whole plasmapheresis treatment (usually about 2 weeks)]
primary_outcome.description: Change of fibrinogen level after plasmapheresis treatment depending on replacement fluid type

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on coagulation tests after plasmapheresis - ROTEM EXTEM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Right after every plasmapheresis session, during the whole plasmapheresis treatment (usually about 2 weeks)]
secondary_outcome.description: ROTEM (EXTEM MCF) change after plasmapheresis treatment depending on replacement fluid type

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect on coagulation tests after plasmapheresis - ROTEM FIBTEM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Right after every plasmapheresis session, during the whole plasmapheresis treatment (usually about 2 weeks)]
secondary_outcome.description: ROTEM (FIBTEM MCF) change after plasmapheresis treatment depending on replacement fluid type

arm_group.description: One calculated plasma volume will be replaced with a mixture of electrolyte replacement solution and albumin.
One calculated plasma volume will be replaced with a mixture of electrolyte replacement solution and albumin. Fibrinogen concentrate will be infused afterwards.
One calculated plasma volume will be replaced with a mixture of electrolyte replacement solution, albumin and fresh frozen plasma.

intervention.description: Haemocomplettan will be infused after plasma exchange procedure
Fresh frozen plasma will be part of replacement fluid

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Every patient who will need repeated plasmapheresis treatment in UKC Ljubljana
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- coagulation disorders
- Hypertriglyceridemia-induced acute pancreatitis
- hepatic disorders
